title: 111_s1520
content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation with purposes that include upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States while respecting the sovereignty of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Nations. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to advocate for American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, promote social welfare, support research on their relationship with American society, and provide technical assistance. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated provides technical assistance to regional areas without veterans committees or organizations, including outreach services and training for Tribal Veterans Service Officers. Membership, board of directors, and officers are determined by the constitution and bylaws of the corporation. The corporation must adhere to the laws of the jurisdiction where it is incorporated. It is prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age in membership and leadership roles. The corporation's powers are limited to those granted in its articles of incorporation, constitution, and bylaws. It has the exclusive right to use specific names, seals, emblems, and badges. The corporation is restricted from issuing stock or dividends. The corporation is restricted from issuing stock, paying dividends, making loans to its officers, and claiming federal endorsement. It must maintain its tax-exempt status and keep records for inspection. The corporation must keep accurate records of accounts, meeting minutes, and member information. These records can be inspected by members or their representatives for valid reasons. The corporation must also comply with jurisdictional laws regarding service of process. The corporation is liable for acts of officers and agents within their authority. Failure to comply with regulations may result in charter expiration. An annual report to Congress on activities is required. No annual report under this section shall be printed as a public document. A clerical amendment is made to the table of chapters in the United States Code. "1504. National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated.....  150401"
